metadata.synopsis: The innkeeper at Elfsong Tavern sells a few supplies and allow players to rest at the tavern after paying a small quantity of gold.
metadata.how_to_trigger: Click on the Innkeeper at Elfsong Tavern.larian://bookmark?mod=GustavDev&level=BGO_Main_A&camPos=-1690.814819;44.993988;669.973083&camTarget=-1691.060425;44.646729;670.878113

19.speaker: Alan Alyth
19.text: Welcome back. What can I do you for?

33.speaker: Player
33.text: I'm still looking for somewhere to stay.

29.speaker: Alan Alyth
29.text: Well, the price ain't changed. Pockets deep enough? ([LOW_Elfsong_RentFullPrice_522a449e-a7f5-0d9b-c835-fc5a24d49d65])

75.speaker: Alan Alyth
75.text: Commiserations. Perhaps a pint'll soothe your sorrows?

66.speaker: Player
66.text: I'm looking for a place to stay.

1.speaker: Alan Alyth
1.text: Tell you what - the murder upstairs has brought some punters, but it's also really spooked folk out of renting rooms.

50.speaker: Alan Alyth
50.text: If we get you staying up there, perhaps folk'll calm down and realise there's nowt to worry about.

68.speaker: Alan Alyth
68.text: You can have the whole upstairs floor until this killer thing blows over. ([LOW_Elfsong_RentFullPrice_522a449e-a7f5-0d9b-c835-fc5a24d49d65])

35.speaker: Player
35.text: You're optimistic. What makes you so sure it'll all blow over?

95.speaker: Alan Alyth
95.text: The City always wins. There's always some hero that saves the day. It's the way things work.

27.speaker: Player
27.text: Perhaps I could get a discount on the accommodation?

88.speaker: Alan Alyth
88.text: Hah! Charity, in Baldur's Gate? Good one.

13.speaker: Player
13.text: You want [LOW_Elfsong_RentFullPrice_522a449e-a7f5-0d9b-c835-fc5a24d49d65] gold to sleep next to a murder scene? Really?

94.text: (Keep your voice down about the bloody murder upstairs!) Ahem.

81.speaker: Alan Alyth
81.text: (Keep your voice down about the bloody murder upstairs!) Ahem.

40.speaker: Player
40.text: If I'm staying in this place, I'll make sure to protect it.

60.speaker: Alan Alyth
60.text: You will protect it? Have you seen some of the big bastards around here?

92.speaker: Alan Alyth
92.text: You will protect it? Have you seen some of the big bastards around here?

8.speaker: Alan Alyth
8.text: The price just went up. Call it a shite-talk surcharge. ([LOW_Elfsong_RentOverpriced_c0839c4d-1481-70c1-e5c0-5a0aeaef4fb5])

53.speaker: Alan Alyth
53.text: Top floor's all yours. If it gets a bit too noisy at night, well, don't sleep above a pub.

54.speaker: Alan Alyth
54.text: If you happen across some coinage, you know where to find me.

71.text: Insurance like that is mighty valuable at the moment. Sounds good to me.

16.speaker: Alan Alyth
16.text: Insurance like that is mighty valuable at the moment. Sounds good to me.

18.speaker: Player
18.text: Point out the tavern's obvious dirt and grime - that should get you a discount.

11.speaker: Alan Alyth
11.text: Oi, oi! I've got a good thing going here - don't need you casting nasty aspersions. You can have it free if you shut your maw.

49.speaker: Alan Alyth
49.text: Oi, oi! I've got a good thing going here - don't need you casting nasty aspersions. You can have it free if you shut your maw.

4.text: It's called character. Anyone will tell you that.

79.speaker: Alan Alyth
79.text: It's called character. Anyone will tell you that.

43.speaker: Player
43.text: I'm with the Guild. You'll be giving me the Nine-Finger discount.

62.speaker: Alan Alyth
62.text: Look, mate, I don't want any trouble. Especially not from your lot.

23.speaker: Alan Alyth
23.text: Look, mate, I don't want any trouble. Especially not from your lot.

69.text: Pull the other one - Guild folk don't chuck around Nine-Fingers' name like cheap dice.

10.speaker: Alan Alyth
10.text: Pull the other one - Guild folk don't chuck around Nine-Fingers' name like cheap dice.

26.speaker: Player
26.text: Cut the price, and I'll spread word of this place for miles around.

42.speaker: Alan Alyth
42.text: What good is your word? Invasion, murders, and lack of cash is what's putting folks off renting rooms.

87.speaker: Alan Alyth
87.text: What good is your word? Invasion, murders, and lack of cash is what's putting folks off renting rooms.

14.text: More arses in chairs means more coin in my pouch. You've got yourself a deal.

91.speaker: Alan Alyth
91.text: More arses in chairs means more coin in my pouch. You've got yourself a deal.

45.speaker: Alan Alyth
45.text: All right, ALL RIGHT! Calm down, you mad bastard.

56.speaker: Alan Alyth
56.text: All right, ALL RIGHT! Calm down, you mad bastard.

86.speaker: Player
86.text: I could wave my hand and turn this place into rubble.

59.text: That'd be a great threat - if you weren't in the building too, genius.

41.speaker: Alan Alyth
41.text: That'd be a great threat - if you weren't in the building too, genius.

9.speaker: Player
9.text: Recite Elminster's journal entry about his free stay at the Elfsong Tavern.

97.speaker: Alan Alyth
97.text: Two little mistakes, pal. One - he actually stayed here in 1310 DR. Two - you're not Elminster. Bloody wizards.

46.speaker: Alan Alyth
46.text: Two little mistakes, pal. One - he actually stayed here in 1310 DR. Two - you're not Elminster. Bloody wizards.

72.text: You can have it for free if you stop talking. Bloody wizards.

2.speaker: Alan Alyth
2.text: You can have it for free if you stop talking. Bloody wizards.

55.speaker: Player
55.text: Have you got anything to trade?

74.speaker: Alan Alyth
74.text: It's been slim pickings since the Absolute butchered that supply convoy - but have a look.

30.speaker: Narrator
30.text: *News of your good deeds has travelled fast. The merchant is all too happy to extend a certain generosity towards you, where the price of goods is concerned.*

34.speaker: Narrator
34.text: *Your notoriety precedes you. Prices have been moderated to reflect your less-than-welcome presence in the city.*

38.speaker: Player
38.text: Tell me more about the murder.

28.speaker: Alan Alyth
28.text: Going to make this place famous, I reckon. Victim is a bloody duke - Belynne Stelmane. Well, she was a duke. Now she's just bloody.

32.speaker: Alan Alyth
32.text: I reckon I'll be able to charge double for that room once the Constable's done with it. Murders and ghosts are always grand for business.

31.speaker: Alan Alyth
31.text: Oi oi, pull up a seat - if you can find one spare, that is!

15.speaker: Alan Alyth
15.text: With all this talk of war - what else are folk to do but drink?

0.speaker: Alan Alyth
0.text: I reckon the murder we had's something to do with it too. Got punters all intrigued. On that morbid note - what can I get your fine self?
